question.question-text: According to paragraph 1, Muir was born

answer-list.answer-text: in the first half of the eighteenth century
in the second half of the eighteenth century
in the first half of the nineteenth century
in the second half of the nineteenth century

question.question-text: It is stated in paragraph 1 that Muir is known for

answer-list.answer-text: his contributions to immigration reform
his explorations of the wilderness
his efforts to maintain natural areas
his extensive studies of the national parks

question.question-text: It is indicated in paragraph 2 that Muir's early education

answer-list.answer-text: was conducted at home
took place in a religious school
violated his father's wishes
was in a public school

question.question-text: It is NOT mentioned in paragraph 2 that Muir

answer-list.answer-text: whittled with wood
was taught how to whittle by his father
whittled mechanical devices
was admitted to the university because of his whittling

question.question-text: According to paragraph 2, after Muir left the university, it is NOT true that he

answer-list.answer-text: took a job in a factory
suffered an unhealable injury
made a decision to quit his job
embarked on a long walking tour

question.question-text: All of the following are mentioned in paragraph 3 as jobs that Muir held EXCEPT

answer-list.answer-text: a laborer
an animal tender
a wilderness guide
a travel writer

question.question-text: It is stated in paragraph 3 that in the years after 1880, Muir

answer-list.answer-text: took some odd jobs
devoted a lot of time to his family
gave his wife's parents a ranch
spent most of his time preserving the environment

question.question-text: It is NOT mentioned in paragraph 4 that Muir

answer-list.answer-text: had been uninvolved with environmentalists for a period of time
was contacted by an editor for The Century
worked as an editor for The Century
wrote two articles for The Century

question.question-text: The camping trip that is discussed in paragraph 4

answer-list.answer-text: occurred in the 1870s
led Muir to areas that he had never before seen
took place in areas that were in their natural state
helped to convince Muir to write the articles

question.question-text: It is stated in paragraph 5 that the Enabling Act

answer-list.answer-text: allowed the president to set aside lands to conserve them
became law in 1890
called for the establishment of the first three national parks
preserved lands for government use

question.question-text: According to paragraph 5, it is NOT true that the Sierra Club was founded

answer-list.answer-text: after the passage of the Enabling Act
by John Muir
before the turn of the century
to move Yosemite to the Sierra Nevada

question.question-text: It is mentioned in paragraph 6 that, for the last decades of his life, Muir

answer-list.answer-text: spent a considerable amount of time in Yosemite
wrote a number of new laws
changed his mind on the need for environmental protection
devoted himself to increasing public awareness of the environment

question.question-text: It is NOT indicated in paragraph 7 that early in the twenty-first century

answer-list.answer-text: hundreds of locations are part of the National Park Service
numerous parks, rivers, seashores, and preserves are being developed
a quarter of a billion people visit these parks each year
more than a half a million people belong to the Sierra Club
